data.title: The Berkeley School
data.meta_description: [raw] [row] [col type="6" class="right"] Social Media Wellness On Tuesday, October 17, 6:30-8:30p on the University Avenue Campus, we'll welcome Ana Homayoun, Social Media Wellness author and educator. With fresh insights and a solutions-oriented perspective, Homayoun explains how social media has created a new language of communication that parents and educators need to understand, and
data.meta_site_name: The Berkeley School - What matters in education is what matters in life.
data.text:
[row]

[col type=”6″ class=”right”]

[/col]

[col type=”6″ class=”right”]

TBS Talks: Dr. Alison Gopnik

On Wednesday, February 1, 7:00p – 8:30p The Berkeley School welcomes distinguished psychologist, philosopher, and author, Dr. Alison Gopnik back to campus for another exciting talk about child development. We are proud to continue our partnership with Dr. Gopnik and her UC Berkeley research lab. She has recently published a new best-seller, The Gardener & The Carpenter, and will discuss fascinating new data about children and parents from the book. Her visits are always riveting, funny, and full of valuable educational data that supports our practices here at TBS. A Q&A will follow the talk. This event is free and open to the public!

Registration Now Closed

[/col]

[/row]

[row]

[col type=”6″ class=”right”]

[/col]

[col type=”6″ class=”right”]

TBS Talks: Jason Brand & Digital Citizenship

How to tackle digital citizenship with your children at every age. Parenting adults of ECC-5th graders are invited to join us for Families in Sync: Navigating the Tech World on Wednesday, October 26, 6:00-7:30p. Contrary to media accounts and fear-based messages, families do not have to be constantly at odds when it comes to video games, mobile devices, and the internet. There are ways that we can thoughtfully approach the dilemmas parents and kids face as we rapidly transition to a digital culture. Parenting adults of Middle Schoolers are invited to join us for The Connected Child: Safety, Trust and Respect in the Digital Age on Wednesday, November 2, 7:15-8:45p.

Registration Now Closed

[/col]

[/row]
